public function __construct($result,
$affected_rows,
$insert_id,
$errno,
$error,
$query_num)
The constructor of Database_Result which populates the attributes.
public function action_registered($action_name)
Checks to see if the specified action is registered.
public function add_action($action_name,  
$callback,  
$file =  null)
Adds an action through the API, adding an action allows plugins to add actions accessible through index.php.
public function add_group($group_identifier,
$group_name)
Allows plugins to add (register) a group that members can have assigned to them, that way these plugins can use permissions for any features they may add.
public function add_hook($hook_name,  
$callback,  
$importance =  10,
$args =  null)
Adds a callback on the specified hook name.
public function add_subaction($action_name,  
$subaction_name,  
$callback,  
$file =  null)
Registers the specified sub-action to the action.
abstract public function backup_table($table,
$backup_table)
Creates a copy of $table into $backup_table.
abstract public function close()
Closes the connection to the SQL database or server.
abstract public function connect()
Connects to the SQL database or server.
abstract public function create_table($table,  
$columns,  
$indexes =  array(),
$on_exists =  'fail')
Creates a table with the specified table name, columns and indexes.
public function data($variable)
abstract public function data_seek($row_num =  0)
Moves the internal pointer to the specified row number.
abstract public function errno()
Returns the error number of which occurred from the last database method called, if any.
abstract public function error()
Returns the error string from the last SELECT, UPDATE, INSERT, etc.
abstract public function escape($str,  
$htmlspecialchars =  false)
Makes a string safe to use in a query.
abstract public function fetch_array()
Fetches the results array (Both numeric and associative indexes) and increments the internal pointer.
abstract public function fetch_assoc()
Fetches the results array (associative indexes only) and increments the internal pointer.
abstract public function fetch_object()
A lot like fetch_assoc, however, an object (stdClass) is returned instead of an array.
abstract public function fetch_row()
Fetches the results array (numeric indexes only) and increments the internal pointer.
abstract public function field_name($field_offset)
Fetches the name of the field corresponding to the field offset.
abstract public function free_result()
Frees all memory associated with the result received from a query execution.
public function group_registered($group_identifier)
Checks to see if the specified group is registered.
public function hook_registered($hook_name,
$callback)
Allows you to check if a callback is already registered in the specified hook name.
abstract public function insert($type,  
$tbl_name,  
$columns,  
$data,  
$keys =  array(),
$hook_name =  null)
Inserts or replaces data in the database.
abstract public function insert_sql($table,  
$extended_inserts =  true,
$rows_per_insert =  10,
$start =  false,
$rows =  false,
$file =  null)
Generates the INSERT INTO commands for the table data contained within the specified table.
public function is_a($what)
Allows you to see if the member is a specified group.
public function is_admin()
public function is_guest()
public function is_logged()
public function log_error($error_message,  
$is_fatal =  false,
$file =  null,
$line =  0)
Logs a database error into the SnowCMS error log, if the error is fatal, show a plain ol’ ugly error page stating an error occurred.
abstract public function num_fields()
Returns the number of fields (columns) in a query (SELECT).
abstract public function num_rows()
Returns the number of rows from a result set.
abstract public function optimize_table($table)
Optimizes the specified table.
abstract public function query($db_query,  
$db_vars =  array(),
$hook_name =  null,
$db_compat =  null,
$file =  null,
$line =  0)
Queries the database, however, it isn’t a simple [mysql|sqlite|...]_query as this method changes the query for any compatibility issues.
public function remove_action($action_name)
Removes the specified action.
public function remove_group($group_identifier)
Removes the specified group identifier from the registered groups.
public function remove_hook($hook_name,
$callback)
Removes the specified callback from the specified hook.
public function remove_subaction($action_name,
$subaction_name)
Removes the specified sub-action from the action.
public function return_action($action_name =  null)
Returns the requested action, the first index contains the callback, the second contains the file to be included before calling on the callback, unless it is null.
public function return_group($group_identifier =  null)
Returns the specified group name, or if no group identifier is supplied, all groups are returned.
public function return_subaction($action_name,  
$subaction_name =  null)
Returns the requested subaction, the first index contains the callback, the second contains the file to be included before calling on the callback, unless it is null.
public function run_hook($hook_name,  
$args =  null)
Runs the specified hook, along with running the registered callbacks of the hook.
private function sort(&$array)
Used to sort the hooked array in order of importance.
public function subaction_registered($action_name,
$subaction_name)
Checks to see if the specified sub-action is registered in the action.
abstract public function table_sql($table,  
$drop_if_exists =  true,
$file =  null)
Generates the CREATE TABLE command for the specified table, if $file is specified, append that data to the specified file and return a bool (TRUE on success, FALSE on failure), otherwise return the string containing the CREATE TABLE.
abstract public function tables()
Returns an array containing all the tables in the database.
abstract public function unescape($str,  
$htmlspecialchars_decode =  false)
The opposite of the escape method.
abstract protected function var_sanitize($var_name,
$datatype,
$value,
$file,
$line)
Sanitizes the variable in a query using the correct methods.
abstract public function version()
Returns a string containing the databases version (Like MySQL 5.0.11).
